justification: The paper repeatedly describes the "standard 5-block Implicit Association Test (IAT) as a measure of automatic evaluations of the stage-1 stimuli."
"In Experiment 1, the measures of deliberate evaluation asked participants to indicate, using a 7-point scale, how warmly or coldly they felt toward each social group."
"In Experiment 2, the measures of deliberate evaluation asked participant to indicate, using a 100-point sliding scale, how warmly or coldly they felt toward each resource."
"In Experiment 1, the self-report measures of moral character asked participants to indicate, using 9-point scales, to what extent each social group was good and moral vs. bad and immoral."
